00028 /*
00029  * This file is part of Lustre, http://www.lustre.org/
00030  * Lustre is a trademark of Sun Microsystems, Inc.
00031  *
00032  * lustre/ofd/ofd_dlm.c
00033  *
00034  * This file contains OBD Filter Device (OFD) LDLM-related code which is just
00035  * intent handling for glimpse lock.
00036  *
00037  * Author: Andreas Dilger <andreas.dilger@intel.com>
00038  * Author: Jinshan Xiong <jinshan.xiong@intel.com>
00039  * Author: Alexey Zhuravlev <alexey.zhuravlev@intel.com>
00040  * Author: Mikhail Pershin <mike.pershin@intel.com>
00041  */
00042 
00043 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_FILTER
00044 
00045 #include "ofd_internal.h"
00046 
00047 struct ofd_intent_args {
00048         struct ldlm_lock        **victim;
00049         __u64                    size;
00050         int                     *liblustre;
00051 };
00052 
00069 static enum interval_iter ofd_intent_cb(struct interval_node *n, void *args)
00070 {
00071         struct ldlm_interval     *node = (struct ldlm_interval *)n;
00072         struct ofd_intent_args   *arg = args;
00073         __u64                     size = arg->size;
00074         struct ldlm_lock        **v = arg->victim;
00075         struct ldlm_lock         *lck;
00076 
00077         /* If the interval is lower than the current file size, just break. */
00078         if (interval_high(n) <= size)
00079                 return INTERVAL_ITER_STOP;
00080 
00081         list_for_each_entry(lck, &node->li_group, l_sl_policy) {
00082                 /* Don't send glimpse ASTs to liblustre clients.
00083                  * They aren't listening for them, and they do
00084                  * entirely synchronous I/O anyways. */
00085                 if (lck->l_export == NULL || lck->l_export->exp_libclient)
00086                         continue;
00087 
00088                 if (*arg->liblustre)
00089                         *arg->liblustre = 0;
00090 
00091                 if (*v == NULL) {
00092                         *v = LDLM_LOCK_GET(lck);
00093                 } else if ((*v)->l_policy_data.l_extent.start <
00094                            lck->l_policy_data.l_extent.start) {
00095                         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(*v);
00096                         *v = LDLM_LOCK_GET(lck);
00097                 }
00098 
00099                 /* the same policy group - every lock has the
00100                  * same extent, so needn't do it any more */
00101                 break;
00102         }
00103 
00104         return INTERVAL_ITER_CONT;
00105 }
00106 
00129 int ofd_intent_policy(struct ldlm_namespace *ns, struct ldlm_lock **lockp,
00130                       void *req_cookie, enum ldlm_mode mode, __u64 flags,
00131                       void *data)
00132 {
00133         struct ptlrpc_request *req = req_cookie;
00134         struct ldlm_lock *lock = *lockp, *l = NULL;
00135         struct ldlm_resource *res = lock->l_resource;
00136         ldlm_processing_policy policy;
00137         struct ost_lvb *res_lvb, *reply_lvb;
00138         struct ldlm_reply *rep;
00139         enum ldlm_error err;
00140         int idx, rc, only_liblustre = 1;
00141         struct ldlm_interval_tree *tree;
00142         struct ofd_intent_args arg;
00143         __u32 repsize[3] = {
00144                 [MSG_PTLRPC_BODY_OFF] = sizeof(struct ptlrpc_body),
00145                 [DLM_LOCKREPLY_OFF]   = sizeof(*rep),
00146                 [DLM_REPLY_REC_OFF]   = sizeof(*reply_lvb)
00147         };
00148         struct ldlm_glimpse_work gl_work;
00149         struct list_head gl_list;
00150         ENTRY;
00151 
00152         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&gl_list);
00153         lock->l_lvb_type = LVB_T_OST;
00154         policy = ldlm_get_processing_policy(res);
00155         LASSERT(policy != NULL);
00156         LASSERT(req != NULL);
00157 
00158         rc = lustre_pack_reply(req, 3, repsize, NULL);
00159         if (rc)
00160                 RETURN(req->rq_status = rc);
00161 
00162         rep = lustre_msg_buf(req->rq_repmsg, DLM_LOCKREPLY_OFF, sizeof(*rep));
00163         LASSERT(rep != NULL);
00164 
00165         reply_lvb = lustre_msg_buf(req->rq_repmsg, DLM_REPLY_REC_OFF,
00166                                    sizeof(*reply_lvb));
00167         LASSERT(reply_lvb != NULL);
00168 
00169         /* Call the extent policy function to see if our request can be
00170          * granted, or is blocked.
00171          * If the OST lock has LDLM_FL_HAS_INTENT set, it means a glimpse
00172          * lock, and should not be granted if the lock will be blocked.
00173          */
00174 
00175         if (flags & LDLM_FL_BLOCK_NOWAIT) {
00176                 OBD_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_AGL_DELAY, 5);
00177 
00178                 if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_AGL_NOLOCK))
00179                         RETURN(ELDLM_LOCK_ABORTED);
00180         }
00181 
00182         LASSERT(ns == ldlm_res_to_ns(res));
00183         lock_res(res);
00184 
00185         /* Check if this is a resend case (MSG_RESENT is set on RPC) and a
00186          * lock was found by ldlm_handle_enqueue(); if so no need to grant
00187          * it again. */
00188         if (flags & LDLM_FL_RESENT) {
00189                 rc = LDLM_ITER_CONTINUE;
00190         } else {
00191                 __u64 tmpflags = 0;
00192                 rc = policy(lock, &tmpflags, 0, &err, NULL);
00193                 check_res_locked(res);
00194         }
00195 
00196         /* The lock met with no resistance; we're finished. */
00197         if (rc == LDLM_ITER_CONTINUE) {
00198                 /* do not grant locks to the liblustre clients: they cannot
00199                  * handle ASTs robustly.  We need to do this while still
00200                  * holding ns_lock to avoid the lock remaining on the res_link
00201                  * list (and potentially being added to l_pending_list by an
00202                  * AST) when we are going to drop this lock ASAP. */
00203                 if (lock->l_export->exp_libclient ||
00204                     OBD_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_GLIMPSE, 2)) {
00205                         ldlm_resource_unlink_lock(lock);
00206                         err = ELDLM_LOCK_ABORTED;
00207                 } else {
00208                         err = ELDLM_LOCK_REPLACED;
00209                 }
00210                 unlock_res(res);
00211                 RETURN(err);
00212         } else if (flags & LDLM_FL_BLOCK_NOWAIT) {
00213                 /* LDLM_FL_BLOCK_NOWAIT means it is for AGL. Do not send glimpse
00214                  * callback for glimpse size. The real size user will trigger
00215                  * the glimpse callback when necessary. */
00216                 unlock_res(res);
00217                 RETURN(ELDLM_LOCK_ABORTED);
00218         }
00219 
00220         /* Do not grant any lock, but instead send GL callbacks.  The extent
00221          * policy nicely created a list of all PW locks for us.  We will choose
00222          * the highest of those which are larger than the size in the LVB, if
00223          * any, and perform a glimpse callback. */
00224         res_lvb = res->lr_lvb_data;
00225         LASSERT(res_lvb != NULL);
00226         *reply_lvb = *res_lvb;
00227 
00228         /*
00229          * ->ns_lock guarantees that no new locks are granted, and,
00230          *  therefore, that res->lr_lvb_data cannot increase beyond the
00231          *  end of already granted lock. As a result, it is safe to
00232          *  check against "stale" reply_lvb->lvb_size value without
00233          *  res->lr_lvb_sem.
00234          */
00235         arg.size = reply_lvb->lvb_size;
00236         arg.victim = &l;
00237         arg.liblustre = &only_liblustre;
00238 
00239         for (idx = 0; idx < LCK_MODE_NUM; idx++) {
00240                 tree = &res->lr_itree[idx];
00241                 if (tree->lit_mode == LCK_PR)
00242                         continue;
00243 
00244                 interval_iterate_reverse(tree->lit_root, ofd_intent_cb, &arg);
00245         }
00246         unlock_res(res);
00247 
00248         /* There were no PW locks beyond the size in the LVB; finished. */
00249         if (l == NULL) {
00250                 if (only_liblustre) {
00251                         /* If we discovered a liblustre client with a PW lock,
00252                          * however, the LVB may be out of date!  The LVB is
00253                          * updated only on glimpse (which we don't do for
00254                          * liblustre clients) and cancel (which the client
00255                          * obviously has not yet done).  So if it has written
00256                          * data but kept the lock, the LVB is stale and needs
00257                          * to be updated from disk.
00258                          *
00259                          * Of course, this will all disappear when we switch to
00260                          * taking liblustre locks on the OST. */
00261                         ldlm_res_lvbo_update(res, NULL, 1);
00262                 }
00263                 RETURN(ELDLM_LOCK_ABORTED);
00264         }
00265 
00266         /*
00267          * This check is for lock taken in ofd_destroy_by_fid() that does
00268          * not have l_glimpse_ast set. So the logic is: if there is a lock
00269          * with no l_glimpse_ast set, this object is being destroyed already.
00270          * Hence, if you are grabbing DLM locks on the server, always set
00271          * non-NULL glimpse_ast (e.g., ldlm_request.c::ldlm_glimpse_ast()).
00272          */
00273         if (l->l_glimpse_ast == NULL) {
00274                 /* We are racing with unlink(); just return -ENOENT */
00275                 rep->lock_policy_res1 = ptlrpc_status_hton(-ENOENT);
00276                 goto out;
00277         }
00278 
00279         /* Populate the gl_work structure.
00280          * Grab additional reference on the lock which will be released in
00281          * ldlm_work_gl_ast_lock() */
00282         gl_work.gl_lock = LDLM_LOCK_GET(l);
00283         /* The glimpse callback is sent to one single extent lock. As a result,
00284          * the gl_work list is just composed of one element */
00285         list_add_tail(&gl_work.gl_list, &gl_list);
00286         /* There is actually no need for a glimpse descriptor when glimpsing
00287          * extent locks */
00288         gl_work.gl_desc = NULL;
00289         /* the ldlm_glimpse_work structure is allocated on the stack */
00290         gl_work.gl_flags = LDLM_GL_WORK_NOFREE;
00291 
00292         rc = ldlm_glimpse_locks(res, &gl_list); /* this will update the LVB */
00293 
00294         if (!list_empty(&gl_list))
00295                 LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(l);
00296 
00297         lock_res(res);
00298         *reply_lvb = *res_lvb;
00299         unlock_res(res);
00300 
00301 out:
00302         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(l);
00303 
00304         RETURN(ELDLM_LOCK_ABORTED);
00305 }
